about.short: Arceon AI is a SaaS platform that automates document processing and claim workflows. It extracts key entities from PDFs and images using OpenAI, validates them via configurable rules, routes cases for human review when needed, and maintains complete audit trails.
about.long:
Arceon AI was created to eliminate the slow, manual work involved in processing claims and document-heavy workflows. Traditional processing requires human operators to read PDFs, copy values, verify details, and decide whether a claim should be approved, rejected, or escalated.

Arceon AI combines an AI extraction layer (OpenAI) with a robust enterprise backend (Django/DRF). The platform ingests documents (invoices, EOBs, claim forms, prescriptions, receipts, KYC proofs), converts them into structured data, applies policy and validation rules, flags anomalies, and sends uncertain cases into a guided review queue.

The result is a modern claims automation system: faster decisions, fewer errors, consistent rule application, and complete traceability through audit logs, role-based permissions, and workflow histories.

objectives: Automate extraction of structured data from unstructured documents (PDFs/images).
Reduce claim processing turnaround time with AI + rules + human-in-the-loop review.
Provide a configurable rule engine for validation, flagging, and routing.
Offer an API-first SaaS that integrates with existing enterprise systems.
Ensure compliance readiness via audit logs, RBAC, and change history.

ai_extraction: Field extraction (names, dates, amounts, codes, IDs, provider details)
Template-free extraction using LLM prompts + structured output
Confidence scoring and source citations (page/line references where possible)
validation_and_rules: Configurable rules (thresholds, required fields, cross-field checks)
human_review_queue: Review inbox with filters and priority
Side-by-side doc viewer and extracted fields
claims_workflow: Status pipeline (New → Extracted → Validated → Review → Approved/Rejected)
audit_and_compliance: Full audit trail for every change and decision
analytics_and_reporting: Processing volume, approval rates, review rates
Top failure reasons and rule-trigger frequency
Operational dashboards by team, client, or department

core: Upload and ingest documents in bulk
AI extraction into structured claim fields
Rule engine for validation and automated routing

ai: OpenAI API for extraction and classification
Prompt templates with structured JSON output
Fallback parsing rules for low-confidence fields
frontend: Admin dashboard (React/Next.js or Django templates for internal console)
devops: Observability: logs + metrics for processing pipeline

discovery_and_requirements.summary: Identified core document types, claim workflows, and compliance needs. Defined product scope and system architecture.

ux_and_prototyping.summary: Designed ingestion flow, reviewer experience, dashboards, and audit log views.

backend_and_pipeline_build.summary: Built Django/DRF APIs, database models, background tasks, extraction service, and rules engine foundation.

initial_launch.summary: Internal/limited release with core ingestion, extraction, validation, and review flows.

v1_hardening.summary: Improved accuracy, added better audit logs, role control, analytics dashboards, and error handling.

budget.notes: Equivalent value for a full SaaS build including extraction pipeline, review UI, rule engine, security, and deployment. Actual cost is mostly internal engineering time + infra + OpenAI usage.

challenges: Extraction accuracy varies across document layouts, scan quality, and handwriting.
Ensuring trust and traceability (why a claim was flagged/approved).
Keeping review workflow fast while still capturing enough compliance context.
Designing a rule engine flexible enough for multiple industries (insurance/healthcare/finance).
Cost control and batching for OpenAI calls at scale.
solutions: Used structured outputs and field-level confidence scoring to guide review instead of guessing.
Implemented human-in-the-loop review for low-confidence fields and anomaly triggers.
Added audit logs for every extracted field, edit, decision, and rule match.
Separated extraction, validation, and workflow services to scale independently.
Optimized batching, caching, and retries for AI calls, with safe fallbacks.

qualitative: Significantly reduces manual copy-paste work from PDFs into systems.
Accelerates claim decision workflows while maintaining auditability.
Standardizes validation across teams with configurable rules and consistent routing.
Creates a scalable foundation for enterprise document automation beyond claims.
